edu.ucsd.cse110.group50.eventfinder

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsd.cse110.group50.eventfinder.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    Class that stores the data for a single user. Is identified by an UID that is defined at creation and cannot be changed.
    Since:
    2016-11-06
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Thiago Marback

    • Method Detail

      • addHosted

        public boolean addHosted(java.lang.String uid)
        Adds a new event to the list of hosted events.
        Parameters:
        uid - UID of the hosted event.
        Returns:
        true if successfully added; false if was already in the list.

      • removeHosted

        public boolean removeHosted(java.lang.String uid)
        Removes an event from the list of hosted events.
        Parameters:
        uid - UID of the cancelled event.
        Returns:
        true if successfully removed; false if not found.

      • eventDone

        public boolean eventDone(java.lang.String uid)
        Moves an event from the "going to host" list to the "hosted in the past" list.
        Parameters:
        uid - UID of the completed event.
        Returns:
        true if successfully moved; false if not found as a hosted.

      • updateFromDatabase

        public void updateFromDatabase(com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference mDatabase)
        Fills in the data (other than UID) for this instance from a given database. The root of the database should be the node that corresponds to this object as a whole. This method also attaches a change listener to the database, so this object will always have the most recent data from server.
        Parameters:
        mDatabase - Database where the data is to be read from.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(LoadListener listener)
        Adds a new listener to be notified when the data on this instance is updated.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be notified.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(LoadListener listener)
        Removes a listener from the notification list.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener that should not be notified.

      • readFromFirebase

        public static void readFromFirebase(com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference mDatabase,
                                    LoadListener listener,
                                    java.lang.String uid)
        Creates a new User instance from the data stored in the given database. The root of the database corresponds to the node containing to the desired User object. If the User does not currently exist, initializes it.
        Parameters:
        mDatabase - Database to be read.
        listener - Event handler for when the User is completed.
        uid - UID of the user being read.
